Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Christoph E. Mottes
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at Walmart (unfortunately for it was $169 there).  It's excellent.  The flash works great and all my indoor pictures have turned out excellent - definitely on the first shot.  The 5x optical zoom and very nice 3" viewing screen are features that put it above other cameras in this price range.  And the zoom works great too - got some great closeups.  Also passed this camera around to family members who are very discerning and they were impressed too.  I definitely encourage anyone to ignore (or take with a massive dose of salt) the negative reviews.  This camera deserves 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: my pics are always in focus now
Reviews.Author: Tim Green
Reviews.Content: I migrated this summer, from a Fuji FinePix to this Kodak M380.  What a difference!  Seemingly unlimited battery and storage (I installed an 8gb card).  It's user friendly, in that there's help text available on it's very large display.  Plus, the auto picture taking capability really works - you don't have to select the proper mode - it does it for you.  It's focus and blurring reduction features haved smitten me.  Focus use to be my buggaboo - but no more.  All my pics are in focus now.  The only drawback is the display becomes dim in extremely bright light - such as you might find in the Salt Flats (think cloudless sky, and white reflective salt for miles around, and sun, and sun and sun).  But, the pics I took there this summer all came out well anyway - see for yourself - right here ... [...].  I love this little camera. I can depend on the battery always being ready. I can depend on it being ready to store more pictures.  And I can depend on it taking perfect shots.  You know, I tried taking shots out the side windows of moving cars - and it did that without blurring either.

Reviews.Title: Excellent "Grab It and Run" Camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas E. Simmons "Camera Fanatic"
Reviews.Content: Some of the people who gave this camera a negative review should learn a little more about electronic devices, particularly digital cameras, before they start complaining. Giving a camera like this to a child, any child, is just asking for trouble. My 21 year old daughter is hard on cameras. This camera wasn't manufactured to "Military Specifications" and will often break when dropped or otherwise mishandled. If you are using a memory card from another camera, you need to format it in your new camera, before trying to use it. You should also be aware that memory cards do fail. Don't buy the cheapest one you can find.I bought this little camera for my wife, who likes to take "snapshots." It is very easy to use, takes very nice pictures (no, not as good as my Canon 50D, but what do you expect?), and is reasonably well built. She loves it!

Reviews.Title: Good camera!
Reviews.Author: Joseph Wade
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I needed.  A small camera with a decent 5X zoom and great picture quality.  Very large viewing screen.  Would like to have site glass for when taking pictures outside.  Glare on screen can be bad.  Overall it has taken great pictures and it is portable enough to fit easily into your pocket.

Reviews.Title: An Excellent Camera at This Price
Reviews.Author: S. Yue "Phenix"
Reviews.Content: I read all reviews before I bought this Kodak M380 directly from Kodak online store several weeks ago when its promotion price was $99.99 with a free Kodak 4GB memory card and free shipping. After two-week testing of using this camera, I think it's really a perfect camera at this price! Other people already mentioned its main features. However, I esp. like the following features:1. Compact, cute and very portable. I bought a 3.1 Mega Pixels Kodak DX4330 camera about 6 years ago, it takes very good pictures but bulky, although it still works without any problems and my wife still likes to use it because of it takes very colorful pictures.2. 5X Optical Zoom is wonderful for me to capture photos and videos for my daughter when she performs some shows on the stage.3. Its rechargeable battery lasts much much longer than rechargeable AA battery. During the past two weeks, I took more than 100 pictures (some with flash light) and about 20-minute video, the battery icon still shows 1/2 remaining power (I set LCD brightness to median, not high).4. Big LCD screen and very easy to browse all of the pictures on the camera.Some reviewers mentioned the soft "Ka Ka" sound during the operation. I am not very good in the optical field, however, I know this is not a problem at all because this is the sound made by the camera when it automatically adjust its focus on the object before its lens when you use Smart Capture mode and keep moving the camera. If you use other mode or record video, there will be no such "Ka Ka" sound. This is not a mechanical issue at all in my opinion.Overall, this is an excellent camera at this price. If you don't like it, of course, you can always spend several hundred dollars more to buy yourself whatever camera you like.

Reviews.Title: great camera..
Reviews.Author: Paul F. Gavoni "tricone"
Reviews.Content: This Kodak dig. is as good as you are at taking pics.  It gives you some lee way to make choices, but if you don't have camera sense don't blame the camera. If you want to take pictures in the dark thats always risky, a camera that allows some choices usually takes hits because some make poor choices.. as they say, it ain't rocket science.. I have a few other digital brands which I won't name and this one is real fun, if your Kodak moment is in the dark, well mine are usually somewhat lit.. If you got a shaky hand with x 5 Zoom,  don't be surprised if the result is blurred.. with any of these less exspensive cameras. When I put the resulting picture on paper.. colors are vivid, sharp and pro looking... inside pictures are naturally not as good as sun lit pictures by about 10 percent. shooting in the dark has eluded me because I can't see in the dark (:>)

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: Jane Newhagen
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use. I took it on a long trip and it became an extension of my arm, it was so intuitive. The only thing I don't like is the degree to which the uploading of photos is tied to the Kodak software. It's a major undertaking to import the photos into Picassa instead of EasyShare. The 5X zoom is fantastic for such a compact camera.

Reviews.Title: Camera doesn't hold up
Reviews.Author: M. Harrington
Reviews.Content: The EasyShare cameras are tempting to buy because they're easy to use and take great pictures.  However, our experience with four of these cameras shows that they just don't hold up!  They last from as little as 2 months to possibly 2 years if you're lucky.  Durability isn't something you can assess at the store.We kept thinking it was something about us -- "Maybe sand got into the lens" or "The plane flight was choppy" --but we finally came to realize that these cameras are just poorly made.  The last one, for no apparent reason, just gradually lost color except for pink-purple; it now shoots just purple and white pictures.My advice is stay away and look for a better quality product.

Reviews.Title: Kodak camera
Reviews.Author: J. Salyer "woodshop man"
Reviews.Content: Well pleased with the quality of the Kodak M380 camera.  Small, light weight and compact to carry in a purse or back pocket.  Sturdy.  Options are not too complex . . even a senior citizen can use!  Picture quality good.  Zoom and focus more than adequate.  Battery quality impressive.  Like the option to charge the camera battery with the USB via computer!

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare M380
Reviews.Author: Jeremy J. Harnish
Reviews.Content: I paid $136 for this camera, with shipping and for the price and feature set, you can't beat it.  I picked it up as a camera for work and have no complaints.  Solid value and I'd recommend it to others looking for a decent camera in this price range.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA FOR ITS PRICE
Reviews.Author: Edgar Tejada
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of negative reviews about this camera, but I discovered that it depends on how people use the scene shots menu. Lets be honest this camera and any other that is not a CANON would not have a high definition finish, but this camera is good for beginners and people who have a limited budget.To me this is a good camera for amateur use or just for someone who like a small camera with essential features easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Byron L. Nelson
Reviews.Content: Convenient size, good features, adequate quality, easy to use, and a good price, so after you drop it too many times, you just order a new one.  Can't be beaten for the money.

Reviews.Title: Software/Hardware Problems
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We were half way to Washington D.C. for our family vacation when we realized that someone forgot the camera.  So we stopped in at the first Walmart we saw and did some quick comparisons and made a purchase of the Kodak M380.  It had a good feature set, including 10 Mpixels and a 5x optical zoom.I took a few pictures with it to make sure it was OK and then put in a 4GB SD card.  When I then powered it up, it locked up and made a soft buzzing sound.  The only way I could get it working again was to pop out the battery and put it back in.  (I've used the SD card before, in another camera (the one left behind), so I know the SD card is OK.) I thought maybe this was a one-time glitch, so I kept the camera.  After half a day taking pictures in D.C., it happened again.  And then at night, when the card was almost full, the camera again stopped responding, this time with a slightly different lock-up.Even if it was the SD card, the camera should be able to protect itself against a bad card.  Looks like I'll be stopping by that Walmart in the way home....

Reviews.Title: Disappointed!!
Reviews.Author: Kaz Lady
Reviews.Content: I bought this M380, since I have had a previous Kodak camera that is a 5mp that  I loved.  I wanted to upgrade to a 10mp and 3"LCD.  I love the 5x zoom lens.  I love the color purple.  Very nice & compact.  Perfect fit. It takes great close up pictures outside or when the lighting is perfect , especially with that nice 5x zoom. I go inside to take pictures and the lighting is ok.  The subject turns out with a black background.  I try different modes, which don't help.  I love the idea of having the dial to get to your desired mode quickly.  The menu is awesome and easy to use.  But you need to take so many pictures to get one good one, and sometimes you don't get a good one. At night, sometimes the pics turn out too dark, and the flash went off or you were in the night mode.  I want a camera that takes great pictures on the first shot.  This is not that one.  I was very bummed!  Very surprised at Kodak who put this on the market to sell!  You will definitely lose that, "Kodak Moment".

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare M380
Reviews.Author: Karen "Karen"
Reviews.Content: We selected this for our eight year old niece after a reading reviews at Amazon and a travel magazine.  The travel magazine rated it as one of the best digital cameras to purchase for eight year olds.  In a couple Amazon reviews, there were some knocks against it when purchasing for children. So far we have no experienced those issues.  Our niece enjoys the camera and being the photogragher.  She has had no problems working it.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't bring myself to like it
Reviews.Author: Timothy Goddard
Reviews.Content: I tried, I really did.  It looks nice, and takes some pretty good pictures, even with an unsteady hand.  But the viewing screen was quite dim and fuzzy compared to the older 5MP Kodak that I had, and the sound that the lens makes when it's trying to adjust just doesn't sound healthy.  With the constant clicking, I just couldn't shake the feeling that it was going to break down after a month, so I went to return it.  I went to ask at the store if maybe I had a defective one, and they tried two others that made the same noise, at which point even the lady behind the counter said, "Yeah, that doesn't sound good.  You might want to go with a different model."

Reviews.Title: will not last very long
Reviews.Author: Joyce L. Brophy
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me this camera for Mother's Day and it lasted until Martin Luther King Day.  The pictures have never been very good,  the features do not work as described, some pictures turn out very dark, and now the lens is stuck open.  There is no usable troubleshooting on the Kodak site.  All recommendations say throw it away.  I have had Olympus and Cannon digital cameras for years without any issues.  This camera has locked up, like it is now, several times; however in the past connecting up to the PC immediately reset to camera. Not this time.

Reviews.Title: I love my camera
Reviews.Author: Celeste Mayer
Reviews.Content: Too  bad they went out of business and don't support the software.Not the best camera in the world but I love it.  It is perfect for my needs ofjust taking fun pictures to post on line.

Reviews.Title: okay
Reviews.Author: Sandra J. Weiss "emerald"
Reviews.Content: The camera only works on certain settings, and when it shipped without the cord, I had to call to get it. not very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: AW
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few years ago. I noticed right off the bat that pictures were blurry and grainy. I tried messing around with settings and reading up online on how to take good pictures with this camera. But, apparently it just can't be done. I'm really disappointed that I wasted money on this camera. There have been so many events and moments where I have come away with terrible pictures because I picked this camera. I've even handed my camera to multiple photographers at theme parks and they weren't able to get a picture that wasn't blurry/grainy. I had a Kodak Easy share with about 4MP a long time ago and it was wonderful, so I expected the same out of this. This camera is not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: RachelinWonderland
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera when I found out the I was going to Ireland for my Make-A-Wish trip. I wanted something small, took good pictures,and had chargable batteries. I wasn't super sure how good this camera would be because of all the horrible reviews I found. However, this camera is great! It took excellent pictures that I will be able to enjoy forever. The charge holds forever. I really loved the features too. Overall great camera!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, slim, great LCD!
Reviews.Author: M. Jecha
Reviews.Content: I really wanted a slim, light, rechargeable point and shoot camera that I could slip into a pocket and keep handy for all those impromptu shots, but it had to take great photos.  I did a lot of research on the cameras and options available, finally deciding on this one.  I have no regrets with this choice, it's all I wanted and more.  For most conditions, I can literally just turn this camera on (in auto mode), zoom if needed, and shoot great, clear pictures in seconds.  The battery life is better than any camera I've owned, the menus are easy to navigate and the big 3" LCD screen is great for my nearsighted eyes!  The only pics I've had trouble with are action shots in low light, but that's a tough one for any camera.  Aside from that it offers many preset options to fit almost any situation, plus it offers the ability to control the settings yourself.  I've had this camera for over a year and still very happy!  Both of my adult daughters bought one after seeing and playing with mine, they still love theirs too!

Reviews.Title: Happy!
Reviews.Author: T. Madison "Avid Jenna reader"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a nice one. Ease of use, great pictures, easy to carry. Videos are easy and capture the moments you want to capture.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: P. Denney
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera for the price (approx 110.00). Lots of features and good picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Poor picture and it makes sound
Reviews.Author: P Alva "Alva"
Reviews.Content: I bought this product after seeing the features, price and its compact size and Li-ion battery features.After using it once, I did not like the picture quality. Picture did not look realistic and from 10MP camera.Even the picture captured in bright sunlight looked like some art picture. Night pictures  and video recored were very bad. When camera is ON, it keeps making some kir-kir sound always even if no button is touched.Camera response time between snaps is poor and you miss may shots when it becomes ready again.I had to return this camera and go for Cannon.

Reviews.Title: Pretty average camera, z915 is MUCH BETTER!
Reviews.Author: Bonnie DeMotte "MOM 2 4"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera about a month ago, and it was average at best.  The pictures weren't great, but it was very portable and convenient to throw in my pocket.  My biggest complaint about this camera is the LCD.  It is very large, but it is NOT high resolution.  You could never really tell if you took a good picture until you saw them on the computer.  It does not take AA batteries either, which I found to be a real pain.  I ended up returning it because I really missed having the 10X zoom, and the charger broke after only two charges.  I bought the Kodak z915, and it is a MUCH better camera for essentially the same price.  Still small and portable, but it has the 10X zoom and takes much better pictures.  The LCD is much higher resolution too.  Skip the m380 and get the z915!

Reviews.Title: nice item, nice colour, but the photos are not so clear
Reviews.Author: handsome spider
Reviews.Content: nice item, nice colour, light, but the photos are not so clear . it seems the function of image stablization does not work well.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: S. Wolfenbarger "avid reader"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my 11 year old granddaughter.  It was here faster than I expected.  She was thrilled when she opened it.  Started taking pictures of everyone immediately.  Hasn't put it down.

Reviews.Title: Displeased with Kodak M 380 10.2 megapixel
Reviews.Author: Charles E. Bianchi "Raysea"
Reviews.Content: Displeased with Kodak M 380 10.2 megapixelI purchased this camera for my mother.  I noticed after comparing photos taken with my Canon SD 850 IS that the photos were very grainy.  I took several photos of the same subjects in the same light and found that the Canon photos were MUCH better.  I called Kodak 800-235-6325 and after repeating everything I said to the technician several times, without him answering any of my questions, as to why the photos were so grainy, I asked to speak with his supervisor.  He simply hung up on me.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: A. Riley
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for convenience, to take places I didn't want to take my bigger camera.  I was really happy with the picture quality and the 3" LCD, the cool color was just a bonus.  I didn't look that carefully at the reviews for this camera (my own fault) to find out some of the common problems that people had shared.  It not lasting very long, making strange noises and even though I thought it took really good pictures, a lot of people disagree.  My problem started with the cameras second day of use.  The camera started making grinding and clicking sounds when trying to focus, it was then that I read the reviews and decided before it quit altogether, I would return it.  I haven't replaced yet, but will look more closely at the reviews next time.

Reviews.Title: Pictures are grainy in low light
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: I wanted a slim point and shoot camera that I could take anywhere. Well , this camera has all those attributes, but the picture quality is horrendous. I have a six year old Sony that is only 5 mega pixels that takes much better photographs. Photos taken with this camera in low/indoor light come out grainy. I am not one to return products, but this camera is useless to me, and I am returning it.

Reviews.Title: Poor Zoom
Reviews.Author: MJ in LA
Reviews.Content: We had an Easyshare C875 that was great. We discovered the video mode was great quality. Not the M380. When you are in video mode it uses an optical zoom which means when you zoom in and out in video mode the frame jumps rather than having a smooth zoom in and out. In the standard photo mode there is no digital zoom. You only have the 5x optical. If you want to zoom in more you have to use a different mode.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: D. Greiner "veteran online shopper"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to get one that was more portable at a reasonable price.  Would easily fit in a pocket or not take up much space in a purse.  Have only used it once so far, and it appears to fit the bill.  My big objection to these kinds of cameras is that they use these expensive ion batteries that you can't find in retail stores but have to be ordered on line.  My other larger camera is a Kodak too, but they use different sized batteries.  With different batteries, that means different sized chargers too.  All these extras add up.

Reviews.Title: Anti Blur, nahhh
Reviews.Author: Donald Dalton
Reviews.Content: I just got the camera in today and I was testing it out.  It is worst than my 5.0 megapixel camera which is 3 years old.  The anti blur does nothing, in fact it actually makes some pictures worse than before.  I am going to give the camera one more day before I return it and probably get a sony.  Do not get this camera, I was fooled by how cheap it is, and you get what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: awesome!!!!!!
Reviews.Content: i love it! i got it for my b-day and it rocks. i totally recommend it

Reviews.Title: Great, if it didn't break
Reviews.Author: Mustafa Skiner
Reviews.Content: I had previously bought a Kodak camera for my young daughters and it broke.  We had been happy with it overall, and the girls loved their camera, so I bought the m380 because it is cheap but also because I didn't think my young girls needed more camera than it offered.  And they don't, but they do need better construction than Kodak apparently delivers.  My girls are not rough and tumble sorts and treated their camera very carefully, but this one again broke, with the lens refusing to retract and then not taking any pictures, all after just a couple days.  I would like the Kodak cameras for entry-level kids' cameras, except apparently you just can't make a camera as cheaply as they do without it being fatally flawed and prone to breaking.  On the bright side, Amazon was great and issued a prompt refund.

Reviews.Title: easy share digatl camera
Reviews.Author: Nancy M. Femali "nan"
Reviews.Content: So far so good. I haven't uses it a lot yet, but it has some very nice features.

Reviews.Title: MY SAY
Reviews.Author: S. Mclean "KoolKidReview"
Reviews.Content: I'VE ALWAYS OWNED KODAK CAMERA ... WELL, FOR THE KODAK M380 I EXPECTED MORE I THOUGHT THE PIC QUALITY WOULD HAVE BEEN REALLY REALLY GOOD BUT IT'S JUST OKAY NOTHING TO SAY WOW! ABOUT. I HAD AN OLD C VERSION AND THE QUALITY IS MORE CLEAR AND ALSO, WHE U TURN ON THE CAMERA TO TAKE A PIC  THE SCREEN LOOKS WEIRD WITH SOME GRAINS THIS MAKES ME MAD CUZ I HATE SEEING THE GRAINS HOWEVER, WHEN YOU DO TAKE THE PIC IT HAS NO GRAIN SO I SAY IT'S OK . MY FRIEND HAD A NIKON COOLPICK S220 AND THE QUAILTY ON THE NIKON SUCKS .... I WOULD NEVER EVER TELL SOMEONE TO BUY THAT... SO THE KOAK M 380 HAS A NICE WIDE SCREEN WHICH IS A PLUS IT'S EASY TO USE AND THE (TEAL) WHICH I OWN IS QUITE NICE. IT'S SLIM SO I HAVE COME A FAR WAY BECUZ THE C VERSION I WAS USING IS SOOO BULKY AND HEAVY.I SAY BUY THIS IF YOU LIKE A NICE WIDE SCREEN CHOOSE THE TEAL TO STAND OUT NOT MANY PEOPLE HAS THAT COLOUR.

Reviews.Title: Nice product but not the right color
Reviews.Author: J. Lein
Reviews.Content: The camera is nice with good quality photos.  However, the picture online is not the same color of the camera.  I purchased this product specifically because I wanted a purple digital camera.  When I received the camera to my disappoint it was more of a navy blue than any shade of purple.
